# EVR628tools

![](reference/figures/hexsticker.png)

`EVR628tools` contains a series of datasets, palettes, and functions to
help in the instruction of [EVR 528 / 628 Introduction to Data
Management and Visualization for Environmental
Scientists](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR_628/).

## Installation

You can install the development version of EVR628tools like so:

``` r
# install.packages("remotes") #In case you don't have the package installed
remotes::install_github("jcvdav/EVR628tools")
```

## Example

The package contains functions with the preface `data_*` and
`palette_*`. The following example uses one of each. Take a look at the
[Reference](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/index.md) to
see a full list of datasets and functions available. The task at hand is
simple. We’ll use the
[`EVR628tools::data_lionfish`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_lionfish.md)
data to make a plot showing how fish size (length and weight) varies by
depth using a scatterplot. We’ll use the
[`EVR628tools::palette_UM()`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/palette_UM.md)
color palette to color our points by site. I recommend that you look at
the documentation of the data
[`?EVR628tools::data_lionfish`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_lionfish.md)
and the color palette
[`EVR628tools::palette_UM()`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/palette_UM.md)
before running the code.

``` r
library(ggplot2)

# First, inspect the data
head(EVR628tools::data_lionfish)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 9
#>   id        site    lat   lon total_length_mm total_weight_gr size_class depth_m
#>   <chr>     <chr> <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>           <dbl> <chr>        <dbl>
#> 1 001-Po-1… Para…  20.5 -87.2             213           113.  large         38.1
#> 2 002-Po-2… Para…  20.5 -87.2             124            27.6 medium        27.9
#> 3 003-Pd-2… Pared  20.5 -87.2             166            52.3 medium        18.5
#> 4 004-Cs-1… Cano…  20.5 -87.2             203           123.  large         15.5
#> 5 005-Cs-1… Cano…  20.5 -87.2             212           129   large         15  
#> 6 006-Pl-2… Paam…  20.5 -87.2             210           139.  large         22.7
#> # ℹ 1 more variable: temperature_C <dbl>

# Now let's build a plot
ggplot(data = EVR628tools::data_lionfish,
       mapping = aes(x = depth_m,
                     y = total_length_mm,
                     size = total_weight_gr,
                     fill = site)) +
  geom_point(shape = 21, color = 1) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = EVR628tools::palette_UM(n = 10)) +
  theme_bw() +
  labs(x = "Depth (m)",
       y = "Total Length (mm)",
       size = "Total Weight (gr)",
       fill = "Site")
```

![Sample figure using data and color palettes from the \`EVR628tools\`
package. The x-axis shows depth of collection (m) and the y-axis shows
fish total length (cm). Marker size idnicates the wet weight of the
fish, and marker color the site from which it was
sampled.](reference/figures/README-example-1.png)

Sample figure using data and color palettes from the `EVR628tools`
package. The x-axis shows depth of collection (m) and the y-axis shows
fish total length (cm). Marker size idnicates the wet weight of the
fish, and marker color the site from which it was sampled.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`create_dirs()`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/create_dirs.md)
  : Create standard project directories
- [`data_MPA`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_MPA.md)
  : SIMULATED biomass inside and outside a Marine Protected Area
- [`data_PIPA`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_PIPA.md)
  : CPUE near and far the Phoenix Islands Protected Area in Kiribati
- [`data_fishing`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_fishing.md)
  : Fisheries production and revenues Information in fisheries
  production and revenues for 41 economic units targeting 3 species in
  the Baja California Peninsula between 2000 and 2021
- [`data_fishing_effort`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_fishing_effort.md)
  : Apparent fishing effort in the Gulf of Mexico
- [`data_geartypes`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_geartypes.md)
  : Fishing effort by gear type and vessel
- [`data_heatwaves`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_heatwaves.md)
  : Marine Heatwaves in TURF-managed fisheries
- [`data_hurricanes`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_hurricanes.md)
  : Hurricane tracks as an sf object
- [`data_kelp`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_kelp.md)
  : Fish counts from Baja California's Kelp forests
- [`data_lionfish`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_lionfish.md)
  : Lionfish biometry
- [`data_mhw_events`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_mhw_events.md)
  : Marine Heatwaves in TURF-managed fisheries
- [`data_mhw_ts`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_mhw_ts.md)
  : Marine Heatwaves in TURF-managed fisheries
- [`data_milton`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_milton.md)
  : Hurricane tracks for Milton (2024)
- [`data_milton_sf`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_milton_sf.md)
  : Hurricane tracks for Milton (2024) as an sf object
- [`data_sst`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_sst.md)
  : Sea Surface Temperature
- [`data_sst_anom`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/data_sst_anom.md)
  : Sea Surface Temperature Anomaly
- [`palette_IPCC()`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/palette_IPCC.md)
  : IPCC color palettes
- [`palette_IPCC_ssp()`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/palette_IPCC_ssp.md)
  : IPCC color palette for SSPs
- [`palette_UM()`](https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/reference/palette_UM.md)
  : UM Color palette
